parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.55.133505 the command also returns ammo for units in vehicles.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''ammo''' muzzle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> muzzle: [[String]] - muzzle of a weapon. See the topic [[:Category:Weapons]] for reference about possible values. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] "M16"; //returns 30 in case of a full magazine</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] "M203Muzzle";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_count = [[player]] [[ammo]] [[primaryWeapon]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setAmmo]], [[someAmmo]], [[magazines]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 17, 2012
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]
<dd class="note">'''OA 1.60''': The command works (now?) also for units in vehicles. However only for the vehicle's gunners' weapons - aka those returned by "weapons vehicle".

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 30, 2018 - 15:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:.kju|.kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Actually the command wants the [[currentMuzzle]] ([[gunner]] _vehicle) as parameter - not the weapon class.
Most of the time both are the same. However when you have custom [[CfgWeapons_Config_Reference#modes.5B.5D.3D_.7B.22this.22.7D|modes[]]] for the weapons, this is likely not true.
</dd>
</dl>
